question: How does the Isotope of Iodine, Iodine-135 plays an important role in Nuclear Power Generation?
option1: It is used as a fuel supplement in some of the modern Nuclear Reactors
option2: It is a bi-product of Nuclear Reaction which kills the neutrons and this inhibits the power formation
option3: It is a moderator used actively in the Nuclear Reactors
option4: It is an experimental substance for Nuclear Fusion
answer: It is a bi-product of Nuclear Reaction which kills the neutrons and this inhibits the power formation
